articles.content:
Greetings to Sudanese President 
    Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Omar Hassan Ahmed al-Bashir, President of Sudan, on June 29 on the occasion of the 12th anniversary of its revolution.
 The message extended warm congratulations to the president, government and people of Sudan on the day of revolution and wished the president and people of Sudan greater successes in their work for the stability and prosperity of the country.    
 The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms.

articles.title: Suppression of labour movement condemned
articles.content:
Protest rally of unionists in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- The Kyongju city council of the South Korean Confederation of Trade Unions held a rally of over 1,000 members in the Kyongju Railway Station Plaza on June 30 to vow to frustrate the camouflaged closing of the Sekwang industries co., ltd. and violent police suppression, according to Yonhap News from Seoul.
 The protest rally was triggered off by the Taebu Machine Industry Company side's false closure of the Sekwang industries co., ltd. and dismissal of all unionists and the police crackdown on the struggle of workers.    
 After the rally the participants marched towards the Kyongju police station in protest against the violent police suppression, defying the police cordon in different streets.

articles.title: "June declaration on press reform" in S. Korea
articles.content:
Suppression of labour movement condemned 
    Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- The "national people's solidarity for national independence, democracy and vital rights of people" held a rally with the attendance of at least 2,000 people in Seoul on June 30, denouncing the authorities' suppression of the labour movement, according to Seoul-based MBC.
 They charged that the authorities are imposing the burdens caused by the failure of reforms upon the people and the suppression of the labour movement is becoming intolerable. After the rally they staged a demonstration.

articles.title: Bush's remark on MD slammed
articles.content:
"June declaration on press reform" in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- The people's movement for newspaper reform consisting of over 160 citizens' organisations and the national federation of press trade unions held a meeting in Seoul on June 29 and made public a "June declaration on press reform" signed by more than 5,500 public figures, according to radio no. 1 from Seoul.
 The declaration said that media have stood in the way of reform and some of them are committing irregularities and corruption under the pretext of the "freedom of the press."    
 It singled out newspaper reform as the first target of the press reform and clarified a ten-point action guideline for newspaper reform calling for punishment of those media which committed irregularities and corruption and opposition to the privatization of the press.

Gift to Kim Jong Il
    Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- A gift was sent to leader Kim Jong Il by the goodwill visiting group of the Communist Party of China. 
 It was handed to an official concerned by head of the group Zhong Qihuang, deputy secretary of the Jiangxi provincial committee of the CPC.
